oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1947-02-06 - KOMA
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on February 6, 1947 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Ann Bond; Jack Beasley; Dick Reinhart; Prairie Songbirds
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening statements and theme / (1:40) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (2:02) Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys perform "Black And White Rag" / (3:06) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (4:02) Ann Bond performs "Good Old Fashioned Hoedown" / (6:19) Hiram Higsby and Jack Beasley tell a joke / (6:46) Jack Beasley performs "Chained To A Memory" / (8:54) Hiram Higsby introduces Dick Reinhart / (9:05) Dick Reinhart performs "Make Room In Your Heart For A Friend" / (11:27) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (11:46) The Prairie Songbirds performs "Tomorrow Never Comes" / (13:42) Hiram Higsby introduces Chuck Davis which leads into Chuck performing the closing theme / (14:20) Closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Bond, Ann; Beasley, Jack; Reinhart, Dick; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975;
